channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2023080163
item.description:
Report E-2023080163

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLU experienced a customer location release of UN1090 Acetone from a box containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and located one cardboard box of LAPALM Acetone that was slightly wet with residual Acetone. There were no wet spots or residual product on the trailer floor. The XPO driver had already separated the damaged box and delivered the rest of the load to the customer. Contractors placed the box into a 55-gallon metal drum which was then transported back to XPO terminal XLU located in Louisville, KY and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080294
item.description:
Report X-2023080294

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on trailer, QA was called. Package was picked up and put into a lined tote. DescribePack: Cap had come loose during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in an upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023071244
item.description:
Report X-2023071244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY, ONE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE PACKAGE HAD DANGEROUS GOODS PAPERWORK AND WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO 5 LITER CONTAINERS OF ASP CIDEX OPA CONCENTRATE. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE.
